Class ChatBot

  • java.lang.Object
    • ChatBot

  • public class ChatBot
extends java.lang.Object
    The code that works the Chat bot and its features. It is small now but more features are being worked on for the future

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String name
      stores the bot's current 'personality'
      private java.lang.String outputToServer
      holds the string that the bot responds to the user.
      private java.util.Random random
      used to randomly pick which 'personality' is responding to the clients

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChatBot()
      constructor that is called by the server so the 1 bot can connect to every client

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String botCommands(java.lang.String inputFromClient)
      main functionality of the bot.
      private void displayListOfChatCommands()
      called on to help a user know what commands that bot has available.
      java.lang.String getOutputToServer()
      simple get method for another class to receive the last output from the bot
      private java.lang.String pickResponderName()
      method that uses a random number generator to pick which 'personality' the bot will respond with.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • outputToServer

        private java.lang.String outputToServer
        holds the string that the bot responds to the user. is actually passed through the server of the connection to all clients so all clients can see it's response. later additions can include bot responding only to 1 user like a private conversation

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        stores the bot's current 'personality'

      • random

        private java.util.Random random
        used to randomly pick which 'personality' is responding to the clients

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatBot

        public ChatBot()
        constructor that is called by the server so the 1 bot can connect to every client

    • Method Detail

      • getOutputToServer

        public java.lang.String getOutputToServer()
        simple get method for another class to receive the last output from the bot
        Returns:
        string that holds the last bot's response

      • pickResponderName

        private java.lang.String pickResponderName()
        method that uses a random number generator to pick which 'personality' the bot will respond with. It currently picks randomly for each response. With the use of the enum class you could have one bot have several 'characters' that respond to the user in different ways. This is currently not implemented but is planned for release later
        Returns:
        bot's current 'personality' represented by a String

      • botCommands

        public java.lang.String botCommands(java.lang.String inputFromClient)
        main functionality of the bot. holds the responses based on the user's input. Can be easily expanded as more features are added. The bot only responds if the user's input starts with a '!' and even then only pays attention to the first word entered. This allows for more dynamic and funnier conversation features.
        Parameters:
        inputFromClient - string sent by client to server.
        Returns:
        string output to the client by the server

      • displayListOfChatCommands

        private void displayListOfChatCommands()
        called on to help a user know what commands that bot has available. This must unfortunately be updated with every new feature. It would be a good idea to implement commands into an enumerated class and loop through enumerated values for better design and security
